summary: This document is an email chain from October 2019 regarding correspondence from Arlan Ettinger of Guernsey's Auctioneers & Brokers, who offered to handle the disposition of Jeffrey Epstein's property. The matter was assigned to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) for handling.

persons.name: Arlan Ettinger
persons.context: He sent correspondence offering his company's services to handle the disposition of Jeffrey Epstein's property after his death.

persons.name: Nathaniel Gamble II
persons.role: Official from ODAG (Office of the Deputy Attorney General)
persons.context: He advised that the correspondence from Arlan Ettinger regarding Epstein's property be assigned to USAO-SDNY for handling.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased individual whose property is the subject of the correspondence
persons.context: The late Jeffrey Epstein is the individual whose property is being discussed for potential disposition via auction.

connections.description: Ettinger's company offered to handle the disposition of Epstein's property, indicating a proposed posthumous financial/business relationship.
Gamble reviewed Ettinger's correspondence and directed it to the appropriate legal office (USAO-SDNY) for handling.

events.title: Correspondence from Guernsey's Auctioneers
events.description: Arlan Ettinger sends a letter offering Guernsey's Auctioneers & Brokers' services to handle the disposition of Jeffrey Epstein's property.

events.title: Internal DOJ email chain regarding Epstein property
events.description: An internal email chain within the DOJ discusses how to handle the offer from Guernsey's Auctioneers regarding Epstein's property, noting assignment to USAO-SDNY.

keyFacts: In October 2019, Guernsey's Auctioneers & Brokers, led by Arlan Ettinger, offered to handle the disposition of Jeffrey Epstein's property after his death.
The correspondence was internally reviewed within the U.S. Department of Justice, specifically involving the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG).
Nathaniel Gamble II from ODAG assigned the matter to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) for handling.
The email chain shows the U.S. government was managing inquiries related to Epstein's estate and property following his death in August 2019.
